Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Permanent

Salary: Up to £60,000 + Benefits

Location: London (Hybrid, 2 days per week)




I am recruiting a Data Analyst for one of the biggest E-Commerce platforms in the game. You will have a huge impact supporting key stakeholders to drive the business forward.




This is a high-impact role where you will have the opportunity to work closely with the wider customer-focused team to help deliver impactful analytics.




Key Responsibilities:

Monitor and report on a variety of data points.
Help translate data into impactful actions.
Present value-adding insights and recommendations.
Evaluate and improve data entry processess and standards.




Essential Skills and Experiences:

Experience with tools such as Salesforce AND SQL.
Experience with BI reporting tools.
Background in assembling disparate data sources.
Experience in working with commercial data.
Must be able to multitask, and commit to meeting targets across competing priorities and deadlines.
Experience with Google tools such as Looker.




Package and Benefits:

Up to £60,000 base + discretionary bonus
Up to 9% Employer pension contribution
Private Health and Dental Insurance
Employee recognition scheme (financial prizes)
Life assurance policy (x4 Life assurance)




This is an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join a high performing and scaling business.




**Unfortunately, due to the high volume of applicants not all submissions will receive feedback.

Title: Data Product Analyst, Direct-to-Consumer
Description:
Company Description

We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.

As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion initiatives, coupled with our Corporate Social Responsibility work, is informed by our employees, audiences, park guests and the communities in which we live. We strive to foster a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. Together, we’ll continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world.

Job Description

Our Direct-to-Consumer (DTC) portfolio is a powerhouse collection of consumer-first brands, supported by media industry leaders, Comcast, NBCUniversal, and Sky. When you join our team, you’ll work across our dynamic portfolio including Peacock, NOW, Fandango, SkyShowtime, Showmax, and TV Everywhere, powering streaming across more than 70 countries globally. And the evolution doesn’t stop there. With unequaled scale, our teams make the most out of every opportunity to collaborate and learn from one another. We’re always looking for ways to innovate faster, accelerate our growth, and consistently offer the very best in consumer experience. But most of all, we’re backed by a culture of respect. We embrace authenticity and inspire people to thrive.

NBCUniversal is looking for highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Product Analyst to join our dynamic team. This role will contribute to the evolution of our data platform into a truly international product. Partnership with international teams and openness to the latest ideas in data technology is essential to the success of the role.

As a member of the Decision Sciences team, highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Product Analyst to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis. As a Data Product Analyst, you will play a critical role in guiding product development and strategy through data-driven insights.

Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To


Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform product decisions and strategies.
Collaborate with product managers and stakeholders to develop data-driven strategies that enhance product performance and user experience.
Monitor and analyze product performance metrics, identifying areas for improvement and suggesting actionable solutions.
Conduct competitive analysis and market research to understand industry trends and inform product development.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, marketing, and sales, to ensure data-driven product development.
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data by implementing robust data governance practices.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in the field of computer science or engineering, or focus on data/statistical analysis or equivalent experience highly desired
3 – 5 years of experience working with complex data sets across a broad range of domains. Knowledge of financial, video streaming and analytical data sets such as Adobe will be advantageous.
Detail and results oriented, able to write detailed specs and analyze data to justify product decisions, and apply key learnings
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar. Experience with programming languages such as Python or R is a plus.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data and translate it into actionable insights.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner.
Understanding of business strategy and product management principles.
High level of accuracy and attention to detail.


Desired Characteristics


Creative problem-solver; takes a high level of initiative, has a strong sense of personal accountability to follow-through at all times.
Demonstrates organizational savvy by successfully navigating complex, highly matrixed and decentralized organization.
Takes an informed and inspired view to deliver superior results by creating value and opportunity.
A bias for getting the job done


Additional Information

As part of our selection process, external candidates may be required to attend an in-person interview with an NBCUniversal employee at one of our locations prior to a hiring decision. NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran and require support throughout the application and/or recruitment process as a result of your disability, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation. You can submit your request to AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.

Company Description

We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.

As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion initiatives, coupled with our Corporate Social Responsibility work, is informed by our employees, audiences, park guests and the communities in which we live. We strive to foster a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. Together, we’ll continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst:

My client within the higher education space is currently looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join their current team. You will be working in the Data & Analytics team and reporting to the Head of Data. This role is based in central London and is 4 days a week in office with one day from home. This role offers the chance to join an established function where you can expand on your experience. But also develop your skillset and get exposure to cloud driven technologies.

Requirements:

Proven and extensive experience in SQL.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management.
Previous experience working in a Data Analyst role.
Experience in Data Visualisation eg. Power BI/Tableau/Looker etc.

What will make you stand out:

Proven experience in Azure.

The client is looking to move quickly and book interviews. If you are interested in the role, please apply and to follow up please email/message me on LinkedIn.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are BOB, a hybrid L2 to build and launch Bitcoin applications. Our mission is accelerating the world’s transition to a fair and transparent financial system through Bitcoin as a credibly neutral, global settlement asset. We believe in a world with access to finance for everyone, everywhere, in a secure and usable manner.

As a Data Analyst for BOB, you will be leading the quantitative insights to grow and direct decisions at BOB. You are the main person responsible for analysing various on- and off-chain data sources to create and track KPIs and identify trends with a deep product understanding. You will work closely with the product, business, and marketing teams to formulate hypothesis and deliver actionable recommendations focussing on DeFi on BOB.

What You Will Do


Product Metrics and Reporting: Track, analyse, and report on key performance metrics, including channel performance, user activation and retention, TVL, trading volume, and other KPIs.
Market Research: Conduct in-depth market analysis to identify emerging trends within the Bitcoin and DeFi ecosystem.
Identify DeFi Opportunities: Regularly prepare and update reports about investment opportunities on BOB for our institutional partners.
Data Infrastructure: Together with the engineering team, design and build foundational data systems, including ETLs, dashboards, and analytics that drive data-driven decision-making and support scalable business growth.


Requirements


Proven ability to lead complex analytical projects from concept to completion, especially in web3 environments.
Advanced proficiency in SQL and Python through your experience as business or data analyst or other quant-related position.
Deep understanding of DeFi, including protocols, block explorers, and data sources.
Eagerness to improve products through fast experimentation, A/B testing, and a data-driven approach.
Enjoy working in a results-driven and fast-paced startup environment.


Benefits


Research-oriented team
Solve novel problems
Stock options
Remote working
30-day vacation
Allowance for a co-working space
Yearly retreat
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Drive Healf’s growth with data. Analyse trends, optimise insights, and build models that power decisions in a fast-scaling eCommerce startup. Join A+ players and do your life’s best work. 🚀

Build the future of Health. Create your life’s best work.

If healthcare were built for today, it wouldn’t resemble the reactive, fragmented system we see now. It would be proactive, personalized, and preventative - designed to optimize wellbeing and unlock human potential. Digital-first, tech-powered, with a seamless experience as innovative as Tesla and the cultural impact of Nike. At Healf, we’re not just imagining this future - we’re building it.

Our vision

Health is at a crossroads. Chronic diseases account for 86% of deaths in Europe, yet the healthcare system isn’t designed to provide the preventative, personalized care people need. At Healf, our mission is bold: to put health back in people’s hands. Through curating world-class products and our revolutionary Healf Zone platform, we’re creating a science-driven, personalized approach to preventative care that inspires better living every day. Backed by visionary investors - including those who backed Alo Yoga, Cult Beauty, Innocent Smoothies and Soho House - we’re redefining what health looks like for the world.This isn’t just a business; it’s a movement - a generational opportunity to reshape how we live.

Join us

We’re looking for A+ players - insanely talented, ambitious, and hard-working individuals - ready to build the future of health with us. If you thrive on challenges, dream big, and want to do your life’s best work, we want to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities


Collect, cleanse, cut, and analyse product, commercial, and public data to identify product gaps, data gaps, and commercial opportunities
Develop and iterate on a proprietary Excel model used to analyse products
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs)
Find automated or efficient workarounds to reduce manual effort
Communicate findings and recommendations to Head of Sales Enablement and other stakeholders through dashboards and reports
Document assumptions, acknowledge limitations, and track takeaways from analyses and internal discussions


What We Need From You


At least 5 years of experience as a data analyst with experience analysing business data, or in a comparable role such as a financial analyst
Comfortable working with large data sets, ideally in Retail/eCommerce industry
Experience building complex financial or data models in Excel
Expertise in Excel including the use of hotkeys, shortcuts, and complex functions.
Expertise in Google Sheets preferred but not required.
Scripting and experience in other programs such as SQL is a plus, but not required
Extreme attention to detail and sense of ownership, with ability to handle a large amount of responsibility quickly and independently.
Interest in analysing food, supplement, cosmetic, and tech data, with a willingness to learn the details of product regulations in each industry
Project management experience and organisation skills
Remote preferred


You’ll Thrive Here If You


Dream big: You’re inspired by solving massive problems and creating transformative change. Tackling challenges that impacts lives excites and motivates you.
Work harder than most: You thrive in a high-performance environment where effort and intensity are the norm. Your passion for what you’re building drives you to give it your all and deliver.
Love to learn: You’re always seeking to grow. Asking questions, embracing feedback, and striving for constant improvement are second nature to you.
Live the Healf lifestyle: Health isn’t just something you practice - it’s who you are. You embody our pillars: EAT, MOVE, MIND, SLEEP, and believe in living and inspiring wellbeing.


Why join Healf?


Do your life’s best work: At Healf, you’ll tackle meaningful challenges that drive real impact.
A+ talent only: We hire for potential over experience. Raw talent, obsessive curiosity, and grit matter more than years of experience. At Healf, you’ll work alongside some of the brightest, most driven individuals in the industry - people who raise the bar every single day.
Energised by what we do: Building something that matters is never easy, but it’s deeply rewarding. We love what we’re creating, and it fuels us to work hard and go above and beyond - not because we have to, but because we want to.
Be a builder: This isn’t a cog-in-the-machine kind of role. You’ll have ownership, autonomy, and the chance to shape the future of health alongside a team that never settles for mediocrity.
Learn from the Best: Work alongside entrepreneurial founders and a mission-driven team, with mentorship that helps you grow into the best version of yourself.


About Us

At Healf, we’re not just a company - we’re a movement. Founded by two brothers whose own health journeys inspired a mission to empower others, Healf is built on grit, determination, and a relentless commitment to excellence.

Our culture is grounded in four commandments that define how we work and win:


We Work Harder Than Anyone Else: Building something that improves lives takes long hours, grit, and sacrifice - but we thrive on it. We all feel energised by what we’re building.
Never Settle: We challenge the status quo and push ourselves to be better every day. We never settle for mediocrity or the idea that something can’t be done.
Obsession Over Talent: Talent alone isn’t enough - relentless curiosity and a drive to grow set us apart.
The Healf Lifestyle: We live what we preach - our wellbeing fuels our productivity.


With Healf Zone on the horizon, we’re entering the next phase of our journey: closing the loop on health with personalized, preventative care that unlocks longevity. This is your chance to help build something extraordinary.

Ready to join us?

Apply directly here. Let’s redefine health together.
Show more

About Us

At Healf, we’re not just a company - we’re a movement. Founded by two brothers whose own health journeys inspired a mission to empower others, Healf is built on grit, determination, and a relentless commitment to excellence.

Our culture is grounded in four commandments that define how we work and win:

  • We Work Harder Than Anyone Else: Building something that improves lives takes long hours, grit, and sacrifice - but we thrive on it. We all feel energised by what we’re building.
  • Never Settle: We challenge the status quo and push ourselves to be better every day. We never settle for mediocrity or the idea that something can’t be done.
  • Obsession Over Talent: Talent alone isn’t enough - relentless curiosity and a drive to grow set us apart.
  • The Healf Lifestyle: We live what we preach - our wellbeing fuels our productivity.

With Healf Zone on the horizon, we’re entering the next phase of our journey: closing the loop on health with personalized, preventative care that unlocks longevity. This is your chance to help build something extraordinary.

Ready to join us?

Apply directly here. Let’s redefine health together.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DRW is a diversified trading firm with over 3 decades of experience bringing sophisticated technology and exceptional people together to operate in markets around the world. We value autonomy and the ability to quickly pivot to capture opportunities, so we operate using our own capital and trading at our own risk.

Headquartered in Chicago with offices throughout the U.S., Canada, Europe, and Asia, we trade a variety of asset classes including Fixed Income, ETFs, Equities, FX, Commodities and Energy across all major global markets. We have also leveraged our expertise and technology to expand into three non-traditional strategies: real estate, venture capital and cryptoassets.

We operate with respect, curiosity and open minds. The people who thrive here share our belief that it’s not just what we do that matters–it's how we do it. DRW is a place of high expectations, integrity, innovation and a willingness to challenge consensus.

As a Data Analyst you will play an integral role in all operational aspects of onboarding, managing and maintaining various datasets used by traders and quantitative researchers. You will work closely with a variety of stakeholders, including technology, front office, operations, research, and risk management. You should be comfortable investigating complex data support issues in a fast-paced environment

What You Will Do In This Role


Help verify, clean, and ensure data is accurate and consistent across systems used for research and analysis by the various trading teams globally
Analyse datasets in order to draw conclusions and provide insight to address stakeholder or project-related questions
Collect metrics and analyse datasets across different dimensions of data quality including; completeness, validity, accuracy, timeliness, and consistency
Perform preliminary root cause analysis of data quality issues
Monitor and work through production data issues whilst engaging key stakeholders across multiple teams and facilitating global support
Assist the wider team by identifying opportunities for improving existing data pipelines


What You Will Need In This Role


Knowledge of a variety of financial instruments, in particular exposure to derivatives instruments
Experience working with SQL
Experience with cloud storage solutions
Prior experience documenting complex processes. Ideally some exposure to Confluence
Python programming skills: PySpark, Pandas, Jupyter Notebooks
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment; strong communication skills are desirable


Additional skills or experience which enhance consideration for this role


Prior experience developing data quality checks using Python
Familiarity with compressed/optimized file formats for data storage such as Parquet and HDF5
Prior experience working with Bloomberg Terminal
Familiarity with Linux and basic Bash scripting skills
Prior experience working with version control software
Experience with workflow management tools (Airflow / Argo)


For more information about DRW's processing activities and our use of job applicants' data, please view our Privacy Notice at https://drw.com/privacy-notice.

California residents, please review the California Privacy Notice for information about certain legal rights at https://drw.com/california-privacy-notice.

[]

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Insights Analyst




Location: London (Kensington) – 4 days in office

Salary: £50,000 + 10% bonus

Experience: Minimum 3 years




About the Role: I've partnered with an events business who are looking to grow their team. This new role will focus on delivering high-quality insights and analysis to support business decisions across various data sets, including customer and attendee data, as well as commercial and marketing reports.




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Develop reports and dashboards using Power BI or other visualisation tools.
Query and analyse data using SQL, supporting a migration to AWS and Redshift environments.
Work with diverse data sources, including customer and attendee data.
Generate commercial and marketing reports to inform strategic decisions.

Key Requirements:

Minimum of 3 years of experience in an insights or data analysis role.
Strong communication skills with the ability to engage effectively with business stakeholders.
Proficiency in Power BI (or similar data visualisation tools).
Solid experience with SQL for querying and data analysis.
Familiarity with AWS and Redshift is desirable.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a small team.




If this role seems of interest to you, please do apply!

  • Develop reports and dashboards using Power BI or other visualisation tools.
  • Query and analyse data using SQL, supporting a migration to AWS and Redshift environments.
  • Work with diverse data sources, including customer and attendee data.
  • Generate commercial and marketing reports to inform strategic decisions.

Key Requirements:

  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in an insights or data analysis role.
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to engage effectively with business stakeholders.
  • Proficiency in Power BI (or similar data visualisation tools).
  • Solid experience with SQL for querying and data analysis.
  • Familiarity with AWS and Redshift is desirable.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a small team.


If this role seems of interest to you, please do apply!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst (12-Month Contract, Hybrid - Financial Services)


Location: Edinburgh or London

Contract Type: Initial 12-Month Contract (via Umbrella Company)

Work Arrangement: Hybrid

About The Role

We are partnering with a leading financial services client to recruit a Data Analyst for a 12-month initial contract. This role focuses on leveraging data analysis to optimize API usage and lifecycle management within the organization. You will play a crucial role in deriving insights that shape strategic decisions, contributing to the organization’s ongoing digital transformation.

Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis & Reporting:


Utilize tools such as SQL, Tableau, and Excel to analyze datasets, providing clear and actionable insights.
Generate reports and dashboards to communicate key findings to stakeholders effectively.


API Lifecycle Management:


Analyze API usage data to understand adoption trends and identify areas for improvement.
Work with API lifecycle management platforms like Apigee and Postman to assess performance and functionality.
Apply knowledge of API governance, OpenAPI specifications, and metadata management to support API strategies.


Strategic Insights:


Develop insights into catalogue usage patterns to demonstrate value and guide decision-making.
Collaborate with technical teams to present findings and recommendations that drive business outcomes.


Skills & Experience Required

Essential:


Experience with data analysis tools, including SQL, Tableau, and Excel.
Familiarity with API lifecycle management platforms such as Apigee and Postman.
Strong understanding of API governance, OpenAPI specifications, and metadata management.
Proven ability to interpret API usage data and deliver actionable insights.


Desirable:


Experience working within financial services or regulated industries.
Strong communication skills to engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
A proactive approach to identifying and solving problems in complex environments.


What We Offer


An exciting opportunity to work with a leading financial services organization on high-impact projects.
A competitive day rate via an umbrella company.
Flexible hybrid working arrangements in Edinburgh or London.
The chance to contribute to transformative initiatives in API management and data strategy.


How to Apply

If you are a highly analytical professional with a passion for data and API management, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to join a dynamic team and make a tangible impact in the financial services sector.

This role is ideal for candidates with a strong background in data analytics who are eager to apply their expertise in a financial services context

Title: Supply Chain Data Analyst
Description:
Who are Taco Bell?

Taco Bell is a leading Mexican-inspired quick service restaurant brand that is a part of Yum! Brands, Inc. which includes Pizza Hut and KFC. Founded on innovation and passion with Glen Bell bringing tacos to the masses in a world of hot dog and hamburger stands in 1962, today we have nearly 7,000 restaurants in the United States and over 400 restaurants in 27 countries outside of the United States. The future holds 2,000 more restaurants across the globe within the next decade. It's easy to see we’re in the business of making tacos, but at heart, we’re a business that’s fueled by the Live Más energy and passion of people serving people

What is “Live Más”?

Equally important to the job role and responsibilities is making sure the Supply Chain Data Analyst can represent the amazing Live Más! culture that is Taco Bell. At Taco Bell, we embrace breakthrough thinking and innovative ideas that continue to differentiate us from our competitors. We have a maniacal focus on our customers, never follow, and always celebrate the accomplishments of our people. If you want to have fun serving great food to our customers, we would love to meet with you.

About The Job

The Supply Chain Data Analyst will be part of UK & Europe Supply Chain Team, a dynamic team that values collaboration, resourcefulness, and enthusiasm. You will closely work with the pan-EU supply chain team, internal and external partners helping to leverage data and insights to report, continuously optimise performance and deliver our supply chain ambitions. You will support the Taco Bell Europe supply chain team by providing actionable insights and analytics to drive decision-making, enhance operational efficiency, and improve supplier performance. The role is instrumental in ensuring accurate forecasting, cost management, and supply chain optimisation across multiple European markets.

Skills

This position is based out of UK office and is ideal for individuals with high accountability, strong analytical skills, great attention to detail, intellectual curiosity, and a drive for results. In this role you will:


Automate the short, medium, and long terms demand baseline forecast at SKU item level in Power BI
Collect, clean, and analyse data from multiple sources including supplier reports, sales forecasts and market trends
Develop and maintain dashboards to track KPIs such as cost of sales, supplier performance, forecast vs actuals, stock holding & weeks cover
Develop and provide weekly reporting to the Supply Chain leadership team
Creation of full end to end commercial reporting – full visibility of stock in the network
Review historical trends, research demand drivers, prepare forecast data, develop statistical models, and evaluate forecast results
Perform root cause analysis on key forecast deviations. Supports Business, Marketing, Logistics, and production strategies and identify opportunities to meet market needs
In collaboration with Logistics and Buying Team, ensure the right stock is in the right place at the right time to deliver customer requirements at DC level
Work with Marketing and Finance teams to combine, refine and publish total business demand plan (in applicable levels / aggregated views e.g., by product, by category etc.)
Create insights from business forecast analysis to drive continuous improvement (specifically from a proactiveness point of view) in Supply Chain
Incorporate market intelligence into demand plans
Lead promotional activity forecast planning at SKU item level
Support cost modelling for new market entries
Work with Procurement team to develop, enhance and simplify processes


Is this you?


Minimum of 2-4 years experience in supply chain analytics, procurement, or logistics management
Data and analysis-driven with advanced Excel skills
Advanced proficiency with data visualisation tools (e.g. Power BI)
Self-starter capable of solving complex problems with limited data
Bachelor’s degree preferred
Experience working at International restaurant business, food retailer, food supplier, or in food manufacturing is a plus
Demonstrated ability to plan and coordinate workflow and outputs efficiently across multiple functional groups
Strong communications (presentation, verbal, writing) and relationship development skills
Strong process creation and optimization
Entrepreneurial
Commercial thinker
High level of intellectual curiosity
Ability to influence diverse customers in cross-functional setting


Why Taco Bell?

We truly believe that where you work matters, and we know a thing or two about what makes employees happy. Join us on our mission of feeding people’s lives with Más!


We are about more than just building restaurants—we connect with our fans through their passions including sports, gaming, and music
We know that employees want a company they can live and grow with; they crave a unique culture that fosters creativity and encourages pursuit of passion, and they look for opportunities to take risks, develop skills and learn in ways that fit their lifestyle
We foster a culture of authenticity and believe all people can make a difference


Work-Hard, Play-Hard


Company and performance-related bonus
Generous pension with up to 11% company contribution
Private healthcare with the option to increase to include family cover
Annual holiday allowance starts at 25 days with the option to buy or sell up to 5 extra days per year. After 5 years’ service, annual holiday allowance increases to 30 days
Competitive parental leave and flexible return to work options
Wellbeing Reimbursement - A fund to claim back costs throughout the year that support your well-being such as vitamins subscriptions, language lessons, gym membership
Flexible and Voluntary benefits including Dental Insurance, Health Screening and Gym Discounts


At Taco Bell, we Live Más and invite you to do the same. Take a seat at our table. Bring your voice. Bring you, just as you are, a Cultural Rebel. We want you to be your best self!

Taco Bell is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to equity, inclusion, and belonging for all dimensions of diversity.
Show more

Work-Hard, Play-Hard

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Data Analyst

Location: Bath, Bristol, London

Salary: £25,000 - £35,000




About The Company

An innovative start-up bridging the gap between FinTechs, lenders, and investors. Their mission is to connect FinTechs with investors by integrating with their data, analysing potential customer pipelines, and providing investors with reliable insights into future opportunities.




By offering FinTechs access to better funding and investors access to high-quality, standardized data, we’re revolutionizing how capital flows in techs and lenders with investors. By integrating with FinTechs, they analyse data to understand potential customers, assess available information, and provide investors with reliable insights into potential pipelines.




This innovative approach gives FinTechs better access to funding opportunities while enabling investors to make decisions based on high-quality, standardised data. The team is small but highly experienced, with a strong background in finance.




The Role

The Data Analyst will play a crucial role in integrating data from FinTechs, standardising it, and presenting actionable insights to investors. This is a hands-on position where the successful candidate will work closely with large datasets, ensuring data integrity, cleaning, mapping, and creating features that form the foundation of the company’s visualisation tools. These tools are critical for investors making portfolio decisions and for FinTechs monitoring their performance.




Key Responsibilities

Integrating and ingesting credit portfolio data from FinTechs.
Conducting checks on data integrity and mapping to ensure high standards.
Cleaning and standardising data to create meaningful and consistent features.
Building data pipelines and visualisation tools to support client decision-making.
Augmenting data reporting and generating insights to drive business value.




Requirements

At least one year of industry experience, ideally in financial services, insurance, or banking (though other industries will be considered).
A passion for working with data, including large datasets, and deriving insights.
Strong SQL skills are essential.
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Domo, Tableau, or similar platforms.
A background in database management or data warehousing is beneficial but not required.
Familiarity with credit data, customer behaviour, and decision models is advantageous.




What We’re Looking For

The ideal candidate will have a keen interest in data and enjoy delving into large datasets to clean, wrangle, and transform them into coherent and visually impactful outputs. They should be motivated by problem-solving and capable of turning complex datasets into actionable insights.




What The Company Offers

The opportunity to join a fast-growing start-up and make a real impact.
A supportive and collaborative team environment.
The flexibility of remote working.
Career growth opportunities as the company scales.




Interview Process

The process will include three stages:

An initial 30-minute interview with the hiring manager.
A practical data task to assess technical skills.
A presentation of the task, showcasing your approach and insights.




How to Apply

If this sounds like the perfect role for you, please apply with your CV or email carlotashepherd@harnham.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Salesforce/ Data Analyst – Ecommerce | Hybrid (2-3 days in London office)







A well-recognised leading technology company based in London is seeking a Data Analyst to join its Business Intelligence (BI) team. The BI team plays a crucial role in providing advanced analytics, data modelling, and cutting-edge data visualisation to generate strategic insights that drive business decisions.




This is an exciting opportunity to work in a dynamic, engaging, and collaborative environment alongside a fantastic team.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop actionable insights and communicate key learnings to global business stakeholders.
Perform data maintenance, process reviews, and data quality checks across CRM systems (Salesforce, Marketing Cloud) and external data sources.
Develop and maintain business projection models to inform senior stakeholders.
Review existing data journeys and ensure data integrity across platforms (Salesforce, Marketing Cloud).
Maintain and support the creation of new data sources and data visualisations (Tableau).
Support the team with regular data transfers and uploads when required.
Promote data-driven decision-making across key business stakeholders.

Key Requirements:

2+ years’ experience as a Data Analyst with a strong business analytics background.
Proficiency in Salesfoce
Knowledge of SQL and/or SOQL.
Experience using Tableau (or similar data visualisation tools).
Background in CRM marketing or data management (preferable).
Strong working knowledge of Excel.

What We Offer:

Flexible working (hybrid model – 2-3 days in London office).
Competitive salary & benefits package.




A fantastic opportunity to work in a collaborative and innovative environment.

For more information, please contact info@freshtechit.com.

Title: Junior Analyst
Description:
We are looking for innovative, analytical thinkers to join our Gas Operations team. Are you looking to build the foundations of a strong, fast-paced career in the energy industry with a growing independent energy supplier?




What Will I Do?

As a Junior Operations Analyst you will be responsible for the analysis and interpretation of data from a variety of sources, identifying anomalies as appropriate. Working alongside internal stakeholders, and a number of third-parties you will support the resolution of customers’ queries, always ensuring customer data is up-to-date and accurately reflects our billing systems.




What Skills Do I Need?

This role would be ideally suited to someone who is highly numerate with a great eye for detail and is comfortable working with large datasets. Ideally you will already have a working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and be able to learn our internal database systems and processes.




What can we offer?

This role offers a competitive package of remuneration along with access to a wide range of company benefits which includes;

Private medical insurance, including 24/7 GP appointments and access to a wide range of professional support. We also offer a life assurance and income protection scheme from day one!
Our annual company profit share scheme, rewarding everyone at Corona by sharing in our success.
Employee self-sacrifice Electric Vehicle scheme, with a wide range of different models to choose from – supporting our commitment to the energy transition.
Access to thousands of retail and entertainment discounts through our internal rewards and recognition scheme, all linked to our company values.




On top of these great benefits, we also continue to invest in our people through a wealth of development opportunities, supporting you to get the most from your career!




Working Pattern

In this role you will be able to work on a hybrid pattern, with Tues-Thurs in the office and Monday and Friday at home. Our standard office hours are 0830 – 1700, Monday to Friday.




Working with us at Corona Energy

At Corona Energy we are driven by our company culture which is focused around our core values; Empowered, Forward Thinking and Impactful – these are underpinned by our central value “Customer First”. This year we were proud to have been independently certified as one of the Best Places to Work in the UK with over 80% of our team recognising our outstanding employee experience!




To support this experience, we also offer our team;

Amazing office spaces, with complimentary breakfast, fruit, snacks and drinks throughout the day.
An annual focus on wellbeing with events and activities to support your health, wealth and inner-self!
An opportunity to support our charity partners, or to give back to important causes by fundraising or volunteering our time.
The chance to celebrate success together, at one of our regular sports and social events or at our annual company awards.




If you are looking for a career that is all about positive energy, we would welcome your application!




Corona Energy is a Disability Confident employer and as such will offer any successful applicant whatever reasonable adjustments they may require in order to take part in our recruitment process.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst:

My client within the higher education space is currently looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join their current team. You will be working in the Data & Analytics team and reporting to the Head of Data. This role is based in central London and is 4 days a week in office with one day from home. This role offers the chance to join an established function where you can expand on your experience. But also develop your skillset and get exposure to cloud driven technologies.

Requirements:

Proven and extensive experience in SQL.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management.
Previous experience working in a Data Analyst role.
Experience in Data Visualisation eg. Power BI/Tableau/Looker etc.

What will make you stand out:

Proven experience in Azure.

The client is looking to move quickly and book interviews. If you are interested in the role, please apply and to follow up please email/message me on LinkedIn.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Risk & Fraud




Location: Remote (London Rate)

Fixed-Term Contract (Initially 6 Months)




Experience Level: Mid-Senior (approx. 5-7 years)

Approx. £104,000 (Plus Benefits)




Job Overview




We are seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst with expertise in SQL, data visualization, Python, and risk & fraud analytics. The ideal candidate will have 5-7 years of experience in leveraging data-driven insights to detect fraud, assess risks, and enhance decision-making processes. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, providing analytical support and developing models to identify patterns of fraudulent activity.




Key Responsibilities:




Analyse large datasets to detect fraud patterns, anomalies, and risk trends.
Develop and maintain SQL queries, dashboards, and reports to support fraud detection and risk assessment.
Create data visualizations using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar to communicate insights effectively.
Use Python for data manipulation, automation, and building fraud detection models.
Collaborate with risk, compliance, and engineering teams to enhance fraud mitigation strategies.
Monitor transaction data and develop predictive models to proactively identify potential fraud cases.
Provide actionable insights through exploratory data analysis and statistical modeling.
Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and compliance with industry regulations.




Required Qualifications & Skills




5-7 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in risk, fraud, or financial services.
Strong SQL skills for querying and analyzing large datasets.
Proficiency in data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, or equivalent).
Hands-on experience with Python for data analysis and automation.
Familiarity with fraud detection techniques, risk scoring, and anomaly detection.
Experience working with large-scale transactional data and real-time fraud analytics.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to interpret complex data patterns.
Excellent communication skills to present insights to stakeholders.




Preferred Qualifications




Experience with machine learning models for fraud detection.
Knowledge of regulatory compliance in fraud prevention.
Familiarity with big data technologies (e.g., Spark, Hadoop) is a plus.
Background in finance, banking, or e-commerce fraud analytics.




Why Join Us?




Work on impactful projects that combat fraud and enhance risk management.

Collaborative and dynamic work environment.

Title: Data Product Analyst, Direct-to-Consumer
Description:
Company Description

We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.

As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion initiatives, coupled with our Corporate Social Responsibility work, is informed by our employees, audiences, park guests and the communities in which we live. We strive to foster a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. Together, we’ll continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world.

Job Description

Our Direct-to-Consumer (DTC) portfolio is a powerhouse collection of consumer-first brands, supported by media industry leaders, Comcast, NBCUniversal, and Sky. When you join our team, you’ll work across our dynamic portfolio including Peacock, NOW, Fandango, SkyShowtime, Showmax, and TV Everywhere, powering streaming across more than 70 countries globally. And the evolution doesn’t stop there. With unequaled scale, our teams make the most out of every opportunity to collaborate and learn from one another. We’re always looking for ways to innovate faster, accelerate our growth, and consistently offer the very best in consumer experience. But most of all, we’re backed by a culture of respect. We embrace authenticity and inspire people to thrive.

NBCUniversal is looking for highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Product Analyst to join our dynamic team. This role will contribute to the evolution of our data platform into a truly international product. Partnership with international teams and openness to the latest ideas in data technology is essential to the success of the role.

As a member of the Decision Sciences team, highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Product Analyst to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis. As a Data Product Analyst, you will play a critical role in guiding product development and strategy through data-driven insights.

Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To


Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform product decisions and strategies.
Collaborate with product managers and stakeholders to develop data-driven strategies that enhance product performance and user experience.
Monitor and analyze product performance metrics, identifying areas for improvement and suggesting actionable solutions.
Conduct competitive analysis and market research to understand industry trends and inform product development.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, marketing, and sales, to ensure data-driven product development.
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data by implementing robust data governance practices.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in the field of computer science or engineering, or focus on data/statistical analysis or equivalent experience highly desired
3 – 5 years of experience working with complex data sets across a broad range of domains. Knowledge of financial, video streaming and analytical data sets such as Adobe will be advantageous.
Detail and results oriented, able to write detailed specs and analyze data to justify product decisions, and apply key learnings
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar. Experience with programming languages such as Python or R is a plus.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data and translate it into actionable insights.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner.
Understanding of business strategy and product management principles.
High level of accuracy and attention to detail.


Desired Characteristics


Creative problem-solver; takes a high level of initiative, has a strong sense of personal accountability to follow-through at all times.
Demonstrates organizational savvy by successfully navigating complex, highly matrixed and decentralized organization.
Takes an informed and inspired view to deliver superior results by creating value and opportunity.
A bias for getting the job done


Additional Information

As part of our selection process, external candidates may be required to attend an in-person interview with an NBCUniversal employee at one of our locations prior to a hiring decision. NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran and require support throughout the application and/or recruitment process as a result of your disability, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation. You can submit your request to AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.

Title: Senior Insight Analyst - Global
Description:
Company Description

We’re ASOS, the online retailer for fashion lovers all around the world.

We exist to give our customers the confidence to be whoever they want to be, and that goes for our people too. At ASOS, you’re free to be your true self without judgement, and channel your creativity into a platform used by millions.

But how are we showing up? We’re proud members of Inclusive Companies, are Disability Confident Committed and have signed the Business in the Community Race at Work Charter and we placed 8th in the Inclusive Top 50 Companies Employer list.

Everyone needs some help showing up as their best self. Let our Talent team know if you need any adjustments throughout the process in whatever way works best for you.

Job Description

As the Senior Analyst working in our Global Commerce & Channels function you will be responsible for surfacing insight relating to our market strategies and trading dynamics. The focus point for this role is understanding performance dynamics within our key markets across customers, products, marketing, as well as the onsite experience. Over time, you may move on to other priorities such as, width and depth optimisation, price point analysis, digital trading dynamics or customer behaviour trends.

The Details


Interrogate internal and external data to surface holistic insight relating to performance drivers at market level, drawing out opportunities and risks and resulting actions for the business
Measurement and analysis of our core trading KPIs such as visits, conversion, customers and our product offering and pricing
Provide an end-to-end understanding into why purchased items are returned, both at a customer and product level.
Deep understanding of our market intelligence toolset and utilising this data to gain understanding of how competitor and market dynamics impact our own performance
Work with senior leadership in function to develop market strategies balancing growth and profitability
Tell compelling, data led stories to highlight these opportunities and be comfortable presenting these to senior management
Act as a data champion within the function, working with the teams to upskill and educate on data and insight
Work closely with business stakeholders like the product and marketing teams to gain deep understanding of business processes and decisions which impact market and trade performance
Work closely with finance to ensure you understand how we measure and forecast market performance
Build and maintain a network across the wider data teams, especially insight analysts, the AI team and data services to drive knowledge and capability sharing
Supporting our culture by championing Diversity, Equity & Inclusion strategies.



Qualifications

About You


Experience working in an insight role focussing on market or retail insight, preferably within the e-commerce space
Strong SQL and Adobe skills, experience within advanced analytics
Strong story telling skills and a proven track record of shaping business decisions through insight
Highly numerate and strong attention to detail
Passion for problem solving
Proactive approach and enthusiasm for sharing ideas and driving them forward
Able to communicate information clearly and concisely
Good project management skills, able to handle multiple tasks and manage priorities as needed



Additional Information

BeneFITS’


Employee discount (hello ASOS discount!)
ASOS Develops (personal development opportunities across the business)
Employee sample sales
Access to a huge range of LinkedIn learning materials
25 days paid annual leave + an extra celebration day for a special moment
Discretionary bonus scheme
Private medical care scheme
Flexible benefits allowance - which you can choose to take as extra cash, or use towards other benefits



Why take our word for it? Search #InsideASOS on our socials to see what life at ASOS is like.
Show more

Title: Ecommerce Data Analyst
Description:
About Us:




We’re on a mission to revolutionise women’s fashion by making it more sustainable and affordable. Our message is clear: we believe thoughtfully made clothes can exist at an accessible price point with sustainable materials. At Nobody’s Child, we’re driven by creating responsible and affordable fashion for kind and spirited women. We are an independent, London-based brand, powered by a passionate team of change makers and skilled people who make our clothes. The good news? You could be apart of the journey!




About You:




Nobody’s Child is looking for a passionate and experienced Data Analyst to join our expanding Ecommerce team to support with the unstoppable growth at Nobody's Child. As a brand new role, you'll report into our Digital Director, and lead on analysing our digital brand footprint - ultimately optimising our sales, improving our customer experience, and managing our stock and inventory even more effectively.




Day to day, you'll find yourself:




Exploring and developing tools, reporting and processes than can improve the insight and analytical capabilities of the Ecommerce team and wider business – with a key focus on advancing the democratisation of data
Preparing the business for data automation. Auditing current processes and exploring new processes to improve efficiencies and effectiveness
Continuously thinking about the commerciality of insights and how we can quantify the impact of decisions we influence – to build a solid understanding of where we can deliver most value and how we should prioritise work in the future
Ensuring internal stakeholders have the insights they need to ensure data & insights are used within decision making
Collaborating with the Ecommerce and cross-functional teams including Merchandising, Finance, to develop company-wide reporting
Creating tailored reports, dashboards, and performance metrics for internal stakeholders
Proactively identifying further business needs by fostering relationships throughout the business




To hit the ground running, you'll come with:




3+ years’ experience in a similar role, specialising in analytics, customer behaviour analysis (web performance, returns, CRM) within Ecommerce teams
Experience with Shopify, and other web platforms such as Magento
Experience of visualisation software (Power BI / Datastudio / Looker)
Experience of ETL (extract, transform, and load) processes and database automation
Demonstrable proficiency in Google Analytics (GA4 & UA) including hands-on experience with event tracking and advanced segmentation
Strong analytical skills and data driven mindset
Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, and across Microsoft Suite (or cloud-based equivalents)
Experience working with large datasets, writing efficient code & generating analysis to tight deadlines with stakeholders
Excellent collaborator, strong project management skills and ability to drive outcomes in a rapidly changing environment independently alongside collaborating across multiple teams




If this sounds like your next opportunity, please apply and we will be in touch!




At Nobody’s Child, we are committed to creating an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace. We aim to ensure that we are always recruiting, retaining and promoting a diverse mix of talent and encourage all to apply to join our journey!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Senior Data Analyst




Salary: £50k - £55k




Location: London




Hybrid: 3 days on-site / 2 days WFH




Essential Skills: SQL, Looker, BigQuery




Summary

A brand new position has opened for a Senior Data Analyst to join a consultancy firm based in London, with their operations spanning across the US and Australia.




As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in translating data into actionable insights to drive company performance, and enhance customer experience. You’ll be looking for opportunities to implement data driven solutions, promote a data first mindset within the company, and analyze / visualize data.




The role is being offered on a permanent basis, with a hybrid working pattern of 3 days on-site and 2 days WFH from their central London office.




The Company

The company is a well-regarded organization with a client base of over 10,000 including significant household brands. Their aim is to use their technology, services and platforms to give businesses the right tools to understand customer needs and goals.




Benefits Include:

25 days holiday + Bank Holidays
Private Healthcare
Healthcare Cash Plan
Income Protection
Pension Schemes
Training Courses
Childcare, Transport and Lifestyle Vouchers




The Role

In this role you will work with cross-functional teams to promote a data driven culture within the company, identify data gaps and recommend solutions, and provide crucial insights into the every-changing commercial landscape.




As the primary contact for data within the business, you will have the opportunity to shape and implement your own vision to spearhead their use of data.




Responsibilities

Identify and analyze data from multiple sources including: trends, funnels, regression
Maintain and develop dashboards in Looker for KPIs and product metrics
Coach the team and the wider business in fostering a data mindset
Apply you commercial mindset to identify ways to optimize the wide business
Provide insights into market trends, competitors and additional factors influencing the commercial landscape




Essential Skills / Experience

SQL
Google BigQuery
Looker
DBT
Python is a bonus!




Next Steps:

If you are a Senior Data Analyst and you are looking work for a company fantastic approach to work, in an exciting and innovative environment, then look no further – this is the role for you!




Interviews for this role will be held imminently. To be considered, please send your CV to me now to avoid disappointment.




Referrals:

If this role isn’t right for you, do you know someone that might be interested? You could earn £1,000 of retail vouchers if you refer a successful candidate to Oscar. Email: rebecca.myers@oscar-tech.com to recommend someone for this role.

Salary: £50k - £55k




Location: London




Hybrid: 3 days on-site / 2 days WFH




Essential Skills: SQL, Looker, BigQuery

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - News & Media




💼 Salary: £25,000 - £35,000

📍 Location: City of London

🌍 Office Policy - Hybrid, 2 days per week in the office







📰 About Our Client:

Our client is a dynamic and innovative company in the news and publishing industry that has thrived through evolution and growth. As a leading digital media brand, they attract hundreds of millions of global visitors each month . They offer a collaborative and forward-thinking environment that values diversity, innovation, and data-driven decision-making. You’ll enjoy the perks of working for a large company, while having the opportunity to propose new plans and ideas.







📈 What you would do as part of your role:

The Data Analyst will support the ongoing growth of our client’s reader revenue strategy.

Deliver key insights into how users engage with content and provide valuable recommendations to drive user registration, subscriptions, and retention.
Lead data-driven projects and help shape the future of the business through analytics and reporting.
Suggest insights based on data, helping the Head of Trading make informed decisions.
Collaborate with editorial, marketing, and product teams, sharing reports and insights on reader behaviour and engagement .










💻 Who are you:

You are a recent graduate, with work experience in media, publishing, subscription, retail or a similar industry.
You have strong Excel skills, experience with BI tools such as PowerBI, Tableau and Domo.
You ideally have basic SQL Skills
You are commercially focused, able to explain how a company can make more or save money







🚀 Benefits:

Be part of a growing, global brand at the cutting edge of digital journalism.
Gain hands-on experience with analytics tools like Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, BI platforms, SQL, Python, and more advanced tools .
Opportunities to work on high-impact projects that directly influence business decisions.
Collaborate with teams across data, marketing, editorial, and product.
Work in a company committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion.







Ready to take on the challenge? Apply here! 🚀







At 3Search, we are committed to promoting equality of opportunity for all employees and job applicants.

Title: Data Analyst, Product Solutions and Ops
Description:
Responsibilities
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

TikTok's Product Solutions & Operations (PSO) team aims to help businesses and brands address their marketing goals through product solutions and also reflecting key insights back to the product teams for product iteration. This role will partner closely with the EUI Strategy and Operations lead to ensure that all projects are completed on time and to the highest standard. This highly organized and efficient professional must be flexible and able to wear multiple hats while working closely with our cross functional teams and prioritising the needs of the team.

Responsibilities

- Responsible for business analysis of Tiktok monetization products. Evaluate business health, identify potential risks and major business opportunities from a regional perspective, using statistical analysis, quantitative attribution and other methods.
- Participate in business goal setting, key direction decision-making and improve internal management efficiency by integrating various data and information based on comprehensive business logic across products, multiple platforms and multiple business forms.
- Design comprehensive metrics framework and execute cadence programs to track milestones, metrics, and goals for key product solutions.
- Provide thought leadership on product data requirements and help capture the right level of data early on to drive product adoption.
- Collaborate with PM, PMM, sales, strategy team and other roles to deliver business and product analysis with clear conclusions and implementation plans, provide decision-making references for leaders and achieve data-driven business growth.
- Provide high-information-density business data insights for leaders and analytical support for day-to-day product-related operational questions



Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
- 5+ Years industry experience (preferably in ad tech, agencies, digital marketing) and advanced degree in quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Operations Research, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics) or equivalent practical experience.
- Fluency in SQL/Hive, R/Python; experience in using data visualization products; knowledge of quantitative attribution methods.
- Strong curiosity; sensitive to data; good at extracting insights from data.

Preferred Qualifications:
- Commerce industry expertise
- Experience in cross-team cooperation; quickly adapting to complex environments;

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Please note; we cannot offer visa sponsorship for this vacancy

Overall Summary

At Close Brothers we look to recruit individuals from all different backgrounds and encourage you to apply even if you don’t tick every box. We celebrate diversity, promote inclusivity and are open to discuss flexible work options to help you balance your work and home life.

Join the Close Brothers Retail team where you will be responsible for establishing data governance controls based on Close Brothers data governance standards.

Working as part of the Retail team, our ideal team member will have previous experience in implementing data controls, data validation, data profiling and data cleansing with excellent attention to detail.

Responsibilities


Defines and manages scoping, requirements definition and prioritisation activities for small-scale changes and assists with more complex change initiatives
Follows agreed standards and applies appropriate techniques to elicit and document detailed requirements. Provides constructive challenge to stakeholders as required. Reviews requirements for errors and omissions
Provides advice on the transformation of data from one format/medium to another. Maintains and implements information handling procedures
Devises and implements master data management processes for specific subsets of data
Supports the implementation of information and records management policies and standard practice
Applies standard data modelling and design techniques based upon a detailed understanding of requirements
Establishes, modifies and maintains data structures and associated components
Deals with problems and issues, managing resolutions, corrective actions, lessons learned, and the collection and dissemination of relevant information


We Would Love To Hear From You If


You have experience in implementing data controls, data validation, data profiling and data cleansing
You have experience with reporting and data visualisation tools such as Business Objects and Tableau
You have a good understanding of how to query data from relational databases using SQL
You present insight to and communicate effectively with a range of stakeholders including senior management
You have excellent attention to detail
You build long lasting relationships with both internal and external customers


IT IS NOT ESSENTIAL BUT IT WOULD BE GREAT IF YOU:


Have a strong background / experience in rectifications and customer harm treatment in remediation situations is highly desired. This position involves working with a virtual team, collaborating with cross-functional departments and third parties, managing business priorities, responding to regulatory outputs and ensuring the efficient and effective implementation of remediation strategies in which data is an integral theme and enabler


We are an inclusive organisation and committed to ensuring our recruitment process is as accessible as possible to everyone. We will make adjustments for people who have a disability or long-term condition. If you need the job description or application form in an alternative format or would like to discuss the recruitment process with us, please email us at or request a call back.

About Us

At Close Brothers we support employees to balance their work life priorities and in this role you will be able to enjoy a mixture of hybrid working.

Close Brothers is a leading UK merchant banking group providing lending, deposit taking, wealth management services and securities trading. At Close Brothers we provide financial support and advice to small businesses and individuals in the UK. Our purpose is to help the people and businesses of Britain thrive over the long term.

To find out more about Close Brothers, please visit our careers page:

To Find Out More About Life At Close Brothers

The full job description covers all associated skills, previous experience, and any qualifications that applicants are expected to have.

To Find Out More About Our Benefits

To find out more about our commitment to creating an inclusive environment:

Close Brothers is a leading UK merchant banking group providing lending, deposit taking, wealth management services and securities trading. We employ over 3,500 people, principally in the UK.

Close Brothers Group plc is listed on the London Stock Exchange and is a member of the FTSE 250.We remain focused on markets and services we know and understand, developing leading positions and unrivalled expertise. Our approach is prudent and considered enabling us to grow sustainably, through all market conditions, building confidence among our depositors and investors.

Our businesses have remained local as we continue to provide bespoke services, and developing long-term relationships ensuring our success in the future. We value our clients over everything else. What they do is important – they are the doers and makers of things, the wealth creators, the investors and the savers. We ensure our services meet their specific needs and invest to support them as they grow.

These principles, founded in our past but applied to the modern world today, represent what we describe as ‘modern merchant banking’ – values that are embedded in our culture and that underpin everything we do.

Title: Research Analyst, AI
Description:
Who we are…

Verdantix is an award-winning independent research and advisory that acts as an essential thought-leader for world-enhancing innovation through our expertise in digital strategies for Sustainability, Real Estate, ESG, EHSQ, Risk, Industrial Technologies, and Net Zero. From Central London, New York City and Boston, we produce high quality research and deliver consulting projects for senior managers, technology executives and investors.




The role…

This research analyst role provides the successful candidate with an opportunity to research different facets of how AI is applied in practice in enterprises. Success in the role requires an interest and some knowledge of the world of AI in a business context, its use cases, and major trends. The successful candidate will have the ambition to undertake a wide range of qualitative and quantitative research, write high quality written reports and present research findings to client executives.




We are looking for candidates who are interested in joining our award-winning research firm, focusing on a research area that requires passion and practicality, and building a career in one of our fastest growing research teams.




Excelling in the role requires an enthusiasm for understanding how technology can improve business outcomes, experience in producing high-quality written deliverables, and the ability to contribute to client-facing engagements. Successful candidates will have the ambition to undertake a wide range of qualitative and quantitative research in collaboration with other analysts. You will establish relationships across the industry, work on all aspects of market research and contribute to consulting projects. Typical clients are executives in multi-billion revenue corporates, professional services firms, technology firms and investors.




This role is paying in the region of £32K - £36K (dependent on experience) with a very competitive quarterly performance bonus.




Our analysts benefit from our structured ‘Analyst Training Framework’ which offers 24-months of tailored learning which will equip high performers to progress to more senior analyst positions at Verdantix.




This is a hybrid role which requires 3 days a week in the office during probationary period and will decrease to 2 days upon successful completion.




What you’ll be doing…

Learning how to use research and analysis to create insightful reports for businesses.
Writing high-quality research while meeting deadlines.
Source and conduct interviews with executives and industry experts.
Building quantitative models to size and forecast building technology
Contribute to client advisory workshops and other presentations.
Attend industry events to help raise the profile of Verdantix in the market.
Build up your profile in the industry.




What we’re looking for...

Educated to an undergraduate degree level with a preference for top-tier universities – desirable to have a relevant MSc or MBA.
Ideal candidates will have some experience in professional services / consulting firm / analyst firm.
Interest in the future of AI technology and services
Excellent communication and public speaking skills, for face to face and telephone interviews, as well as presentations to clients and webinars
Proven ability to quickly write high quality reports for a business audience.
High ethical standards




Additional benefits we offer…

Competitive salary (with annual review)
Performance-driven quarterly bonus scheme
Pension with enhanced employer contribution
Generous holiday entitlement, accruing an extra day with every year worked (local capping applies)
Quarterly employee recognition scheme
Hybrid working option, with the aim of promoting flexibility and work-life balance
Private medical insurance, including online GP service, mental health support and discounted gym memberships
Enhanced family-friendly benefits
Weekly ‘flexi-hour’ to extend a lunch break or finish early on your day of choice
Cycle to work scheme - tax-efficient purchase of a bike, bike accessories, or both
Time off for volunteering when done through our partner OnHand: an app for local volunteering and climate action
Multiple social events throughout the year, including Company Ramble & Sports Day
Strong focus on learning and development with career plans for all employees
Dog-friendly office
Fantastic colleagues with a great sense of humour!




Why Verdantix...

We seek individuals with a passionate belief in sustainability. People who thrive at Verdantix have a proven work ethic, a desire to be challenged, a strong sense of curiosity, a competitive attitude and a world class sense of humour. Our management culture and career development is based on achievements, skills and behaviours with quarterly reviews that keep individuals and the firm on track. We recognize that everyone on the Verdantix team has a significant contribution to make to the growth of the business. So we operate with a high level of transparency about business performance and include all employees in big decisions such as growth strategies and new product launches. Come and join our growing team!




Verdantix is a winner of the ‘2021 Queen’s Award for Enterprise' in the International Trade category. The Queen’s Awards for Enterprise are the most prestigious trade awards in the United Kingdom. Verdantix won the Queen’s Award due to its sustained growth in international trade over a period of three years – including through the pandemic. This rapid, consistent growth reflects demand for the high-quality research and advisory services that Verdantix provides to clients in 17 countries.




Verdantix is an equal opportunities employer and is committed to providing a work environment that is free from all forms of discrimination. We want our recruitment process to reflect that. Please tell your recruitment partner directly if there’s anything you need to make our interview process more accessible.
