  • Knowledge of sustainable practices and ESG principles, and their application in business contexts is highly desirable
  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, or a related field; advanced degree is a plus
  • Minimum 3 years of relevant experience in data analysis or a similar role, preferably within the logistics, delivery, or e-commerce sectors.


Join us at GoGreen Tech and play a vital role in shaping the future of delivery services while promoting sustainable practices and positive ESG impact in our community.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Quality Verification
Description:
The Sr. Data Analyst role develops business intelligence products and leads data initiatives to enhance data maturity for our Quality Verification teams. You will use your advanced technical knowledge of SQL programming, ETL pipeline development, and data visualisation tools to analyse data and identify trends, driving decision-making across our organisation.

You will report to the Senior Analytics Manager.

What You Will Do


You will define the data analytics roadmap for some of EA's largest titles.
You will use your technical skills to develop data products that improve decision-making across the Quality Verification organization.
You will define best practices in data analytics and visualization tools.
You will create data governance practices to improve our organisation's data maturity.
You will provide coaching for Data Analyst colleagues.


The Next Great Senior Data Analyst Requires


3+ years of professional analytical experience.
Advanced SQL skills and practical experience in other languages such as R, SAS, or Python.
Able to develop data modelling and warehousing solutions.
Able to plan and prioritise multiple concurrent projects.
Able to foster working relationships with partners.


COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs). BASE SALARY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria)
$89,300 - $123,000 CAD

In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

Title: Data Analytics Co-op
Description:
Co-op Start Date: April 14, 2025

Duration: 8 months

Positions available: 1

Are you eager to get hands-on experience with innovative talent technology tools used by a global company? This is your chance! As a Co-op student on our Global Talent Technology & Attraction team based in Vancouver, you'll be at the forefront of supporting multiple geographically dispersed client groups. Gain valuable experience in application configuration, deployment, data analysis, and operational support, impacting the entire employee lifecycle!

Our ideal candidate has a high level of attention to detail and can use their data analysis skills to identify areas for process optimization. Their technical background in data preparation, analysis and visualization will be instrumental in creating insightful Power BI dashboards to support our global client groups.

Responsibilities


Evaluate, configure, deploy, and support commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) products, while resolving critical application errors and incoming support tickets.
Gather, extract and clean data from various sources, ensuring data integrity and quality.
Analyze large datasets using statistical methods and data visualization tools to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities for improvement.
Convert data-driven insights into practical business suggestions, assisting collaborators in comprehending and addressing key challenges and opportunities.
Build visually appealing and insightful data visualizations in Power BI to communicate sophisticated data analysis results to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability by conducting regular data audits and performing validation checks.
Continuously seek and implement improvements in data collection, analysis, and reporting to enhance overall efficiency and effectiveness.


Qualifications


Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s program in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
Proficient in Python, with experience in libraries such as pandas, NumPy, matplotlib, and seaborn for data manipulation and visualization.
Basic knowledge of relational databases and SQL for data querying.
Experience creating dashboards and reports using Power BI or similar business intelligence tools.
Experience in front-line customer service or technical support, with superb communication skills to convey technical concepts to non-technical collaborators.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to tackle challenges and seek guidance when needed.
Must be enrolled in a recognized and accredited co-op program at a Canadian post-secondary institution throughout the duration of the term, available for full-time work, and willing to relocate to Vancouver, BC if currently studying outside of Metro Vancouver.


Nice to Have


Understanding of how to use RESTful APIs. Familiarity with authorization frameworks (e.g., OAuth 2.0, SAML 2.0, SCIM).
Solid understanding of Agile methodologies and their benefits, enabling effective collaboration, adaptability, and continuous improvement within a team environment.
Familiarity with Azure DevOps and other agile tools for project management.


Why consider Teck Resources Limited for your Co-op Placement?

At Teck, we offer more than just a job – we provide a comprehensive student experience comprised of relevant, hands-on work, vibrant social activities, extensive networking opportunities, and rich professional development. With captivating projects set against stunning backdrops, a culture of inclusivity and collaboration, and boundless opportunities to learn, grow, and have fun, joining us means embracing a fulfilling and dynamic co-op adventure.

In addition to excellent compensation, Teck co-ops receive a variety of advantages including but not limited to: 


Financial assistance to help with travel costs and co-op fees
Opportunity to develop technical skills and gain practical experience while applying academic knowledge to real-world mining operations and projects
Enjoy mentorship and guidance from experienced specialists in their respective fields
Receive primary consideration for professional positions upon graduation


Salary Range: $3900 - $4900 / Month

Salary is commensurate with the number of academic semesters and prior co-op experiences completed.

About Teck

At Teck, we value diversity. Our teams work collaboratively and respect each person’s unique perspective and contribution.

Teck is one of Canada's leading mining companies, focused on providing products that are essential to building a better quality of life for people around the globe.

Our commitment to our people is why Teck has been named one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers for seven consecutive years, listed as one of Canada's Top Employers for Young People and named to the 2024 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index.

The pursuit of sustainability guides Teck's approach to business and we are proud to be recognized as one of the 2024 Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations by Corporate Knights.

Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, its shares are listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbols TECK.A and TECK.B and the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TECK.

Learn more about Teck at www.teck.com or follow @TeckResources.

We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for the position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst, Cloud Control Engineering
Description:
Job Summary

Job Description

The Opportunity

Join an innovative team as a Data Analyst in the Cloud Control Engineering team at RBC. In this role, you will be an integral part of managing and building our program KRIs. We are looking for a passionate and creative Data Analyst who is excited about problem-solving and working with the latest technologies.

As a member of our team, you will collaborate closely with Risk, SREs, Platform Engineers, Architects, and Security Professionals. Your contributions will be vital in maintaining and enhancing our program's compliance across an agile framework. Additionally, you will participate in a support on-call rotation, demonstrating flexibility and dedication to our 24/7 operational needs.

What will you do?


Analyze structured and unstructured data using statistical techniques and create dashboards & reports in visualization tools
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data streams
Manage and support the development and implementation of Key Risk Indicators (KRI) & Metric processes for the cloud program
Collaborate with technical teams to keep key metrics and KRIs in green
Guide technical teams, provide education and thought leadership
Utilize the latest technologies available, design, and build data solutions to meet business needs
Take ownership and have ability to effectively collaborate with multi-disciplinary teams to drive work to completion under restrictive timelines. Has creativity, energy, and passion for leveraging technology to transform our industry; the belief that automation is the only way and the ability to talk for hours as to why.
Thrive on challenges and have a proven ability to set ambitious but achievable goals and surpass them.
At RBC, we work together. You will be the type of person that brings that approach to your work. You will have a proven ability to build, grow, and maintain relationships both internally and externally.


What do you need to succeed?

Must-have


A relevant degree or certificate in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, or a comparable field of study, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience using tools like Splunk, ELK, Tableau to visualize and report data.
Experience in coding with a variety of languages like Python, Scala, or Java.
Experience with relational databases and NoSQL data stores.
Experience with scheduling tools, such as Air Flow.


Nice to Have:


Experience with control frameworks (e.g., CSA, NIST, Custom) and/or Regulatory Audits.
Experience working in a large enterprise organization and/or Financial Sector Institution.
An understanding of cloud and experience working with cloud technologies


RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
A world-class training program in financial services
Flexible work/life balance options
Opportunities to do challenging work


#TECHPJ

Job Skills

Cloud Computing, Cloud Platform, Knowledge Organization, Organizational Change Management, Product Services, Requirements Analysis, Risk Management, Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), Systems Thinking, Transformation Strategy

Additional Job Details

Address:

330 FRONT ST W:TORONTO

City:

TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

TECHNOLOGY AND OPERATIONS

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2025-01-31

Application Deadline:

2025-02-17

Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the application deadline date above

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at jobs.rbc.com</a/span>

Title: Data Analyst Co-op - May 2025 - Demonware (Vancouver)
Description:
Job Title:

Data Analyst Co-op - May 2025 - Demonware (Vancouver)

Requisition ID:

R024743

Job Description:

Data Analyst Co-op

Demonware (Activision), Vancouver

May 2025

This role will be required to be onsite at the Demonware Vancouver office following the team's work schedule (hybrid, 3 days a week), a relocation package may be offered depending on eligibility.

The Company

Demonware is a member of the Activision family of studios. We work alongside engineers and creatives at our AAA partner studios and deliver the online and data services required by our franchises. We craft, develop, and host services for some of the world’s biggest video game franchises, including Call of Duty and Crash Bandicoot.

We are a technology company and dedicated to openness. This means collaborating to tackle problems, the freedom to talk to anyone, and the best idea wins. We take the work seriously; ourselves, not so much!

We’re open to work terms of 8+ months. If you just graduated, we still want to hear from you!

Big Company Challenges, Small Company Culture

Demonware hosts millions of concurrently connected players. Some of the technologies we use are Python, Java, Linux, Vitess, Kafka, Pinot, Spark, Databricks, Tableau. We solve tough problems on a day-to-day basis, and our Co-op students have a huge impact on what we do.

We’re looking for a Data Analyst to partner closely with our Product team to drive data-informed decision-making. You’ll play a critical role in uncovering insights, measuring product performance, and helping shape the product roadmap. Think of yourself as the go-to person for turning raw data into actionable insights that fuel product innovation.

The Role


Analyze and interpret data from a variety of systems, including but not limited to fraud analysis, disruptive behavior, and prosocial behavior in gaming communities.
Build,maintain, and improve dashboards and reports that inform decision making and strategy.
Identify and interpret trends and anomalies in the data, and offer opinions in support of product strategy.
Filter, clean, and validate data to ensure accuracy and reliability in reporting and analysis.
Present data findings and recommendations regularly to the Product team and other stakeholders.
Proactively surface insights and recommendations to improve player experience, reduce fraud, and foster positive behavior in gaming communities.
Collaborate regularly with Activision data science/machine learning teams and game studios.
This role is part of the Demonware product team and as a result will require an inquisitive mind that cares about the “why” behind the data.


Requirements


Strong attention to detail.
Proficiency in Structured Query Language (SQL).
Ability to work collaboratively with multiple teams across Activision.
Passionate about data and applying an analytical mindset to inform product decisions.
Ability to conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) and provide insights into key metrics.
A proactive attitude and eagerness to learn.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to present findings in a clear and actionable way.
The ability to work well, both autonomously, as part of a larger team, and asynchronously.


Nice-to-haves


Experience with Tableau.
Experience with proposing and running experiments.
Basic understanding of Machine Learning techniques for data analysis.
Knowledge of Big Data technologies such as Spark.
Experience in using project management tools.


Perks


Complimentary breakfast, lunch, and drinks from a fully stocked kitchen
BBQs and Lunch & Learns
City-center office location
Vacation allowance
Competitive pay
Free games


How To Apply

You can apply directly through your Co-op office or directly apply at demonware.net

If you are not applying through your school program, please submit your resume, cover letter (optional but preferred) and a copy of your most recent school transcripts.

The standard base pay range for this role is 65,000 CAD annually. This value is the expected annualized base pay of interns in British Columbia, Canada. Ultimately, your offer will be based on several factors, including relevant education, performance, and work location. Your Talent Professional can share additional details for this role during the hiring process.

We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.

Our World

At Activision, we strive to create the most iconic brands in gaming and entertainment. We’re driven by our mission to deliver unrivaled gaming experiences for the world to enjoy, together. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, Crash Bandicoot™, Tony Hawk’s™ Pro Skater™, and Guitar Hero®. As a leading worldwide developer, publisher and distributor of interactive entertainment and products, our “press start” is simple: delight hundreds of millions of players around the world with innovative, fun, thrilling, and engaging entertainment experiences.

We’re not just looking back at our decades-long legacy; we’re forging ahead to keep advancing gameplay with some of the most popular titles and sophisticated technology in the world. We have bold ambitions to create the most inclusive company as we know our success comes from the passionate, creative, and diverse teams within our organization.

We’re in the business of delivering fun and unforgettable entertainment for our player community to enjoy. And our future opportunities have never been greater — this could be your opportunity to level up.

Ready to Activate Your Future?

The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.

We are committed to working with and providing reasonable assistance to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you are a disabled individual requiring an accommodation to apply for an open position, please email your request to accommodationrequests@activisionblizzard.com. General employment questions cannot be accepted or processed here. Thank you for your interest.

Rewards

We Provide a Suite Of Benefits That Promote Physical, Emotional And Financial Well-being For 'Every World' - We've Got Our Employees Covered! Subject To Eligibility Requirements, The Company Offers Comprehensive Benefits Including:


Extended health plan, including medical, dental, vision, life and AD&D insurance, for employees and their dependents, as well as disability insurance;
RRSP with Company match, tuition reimbursement, charitable donation matching;
Paid holidays and vacation, paid sick time, compassion and bereavement leaves, parental leave;
Mental health & wellbeing programs, fitness programs, free and discounted games, and a variety of other benefit programs like supplemental life & critical illness, legal service, and others;
If the Company requires that you move geographic locations for the job, then you may also be eligible for relocation assistance.


Eligibility to participate in these benefits may vary for part time and temporary full-time employees and interns with the Company.

The standard base pay range for this role is $45,202.50 - $95,655.00 CAD. These values reflect the expected annualized base pay range of new hires in British Columbia, Canada. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location. In addition to a competitive base pay, employees in this role may be eligible for incentive compensation. Incentive compensation is not guaranteed.

  • Present data findings and recommendations regularly to the Product team and other stakeholders.
  • Proactively surface insights and recommendations to improve player experience, reduce fraud, and foster positive behavior in gaming communities.
  • Collaborate regularly with Activision data science/machine learning teams and game studios.
  • This role is part of the Demonware product team and as a result will require an inquisitive mind that cares about the “why” behind the data.

Requirements

  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Proficiency in Structured Query Language (SQL).
  • Ability to work collaboratively with multiple teams across Activision.
  • Passionate about data and applying an analytical mindset to inform product decisions.
  • Ability to conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) and provide insights into key metrics.
  • A proactive attitude and eagerness to learn.
  • Strong communication skills, with the ability to present findings in a clear and actionable way.
  • The ability to work well, both autonomously, as part of a larger team, and asynchronously.

Nice-to-haves

  • Experience with Tableau.
  • Experience with proposing and running experiments.
  • Basic understanding of Machine Learning techniques for data analysis.
  • Knowledge of Big Data technologies such as Spark.
  • Experience in using project management tools.

Perks

  • Complimentary breakfast, lunch, and drinks from a fully stocked kitchen
  • BBQs and Lunch & Learns
  • City-center office location
  • Vacation allowance
  • Competitive pay
  • Free games

How To Apply

You can apply directly through your Co-op office or directly apply at demonware.net

If you are not applying through your school program, please submit your resume, cover letter (optional but preferred) and a copy of your most recent school transcripts.

The standard base pay range for this role is 65,000 CAD annually. This value is the expected annualized base pay of interns in British Columbia, Canada. Ultimately, your offer will be based on several factors, including relevant education, performance, and work location. Your Talent Professional can share additional details for this role during the hiring process.

We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.

Our World

At Activision, we strive to create the most iconic brands in gaming and entertainment. We’re driven by our mission to deliver unrivaled gaming experiences for the world to enjoy, together. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, Crash Bandicoot™, Tony Hawk’s™ Pro Skater™, and Guitar Hero®. As a leading worldwide developer, publisher and distributor of interactive entertainment and products, our “press start” is simple: delight hundreds of millions of players around the world with innovative, fun, thrilling, and engaging entertainment experiences.

We’re not just looking back at our decades-long legacy; we’re forging ahead to keep advancing gameplay with some of the most popular titles and sophisticated technology in the world. We have bold ambitions to create the most inclusive company as we know our success comes from the passionate, creative, and diverse teams within our organization.

We’re in the business of delivering fun and unforgettable entertainment for our player community to enjoy. And our future opportunities have never been greater — this could be your opportunity to level up.

Ready to Activate Your Future?

The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.

We are committed to working with and providing reasonable assistance to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you are a disabled individual requiring an accommodation to apply for an open position, please email your request to accommodationrequests@activisionblizzard.com. General employment questions cannot be accepted or processed here. Thank you for your interest.

Rewards

We Provide a Suite Of Benefits That Promote Physical, Emotional And Financial Well-being For 'Every World' - We've Got Our Employees Covered! Subject To Eligibility Requirements, The Company Offers Comprehensive Benefits Including:

  • Extended health plan, including medical, dental, vision, life and AD&D insurance, for employees and their dependents, as well as disability insurance;
  • RRSP with Company match, tuition reimbursement, charitable donation matching;
  • Paid holidays and vacation, paid sick time, compassion and bereavement leaves, parental leave;
  • Mental health & wellbeing programs, fitness programs, free and discounted games, and a variety of other benefit programs like supplemental life & critical illness, legal service, and others;
  • If the Company requires that you move geographic locations for the job, then you may also be eligible for relocation assistance.

Eligibility to participate in these benefits may vary for part time and temporary full-time employees and interns with the Company.

The standard base pay range for this role is $45,202.50 - $95,655.00 CAD. These values reflect the expected annualized base pay range of new hires in British Columbia, Canada. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location. In addition to a competitive base pay, employees in this role may be eligible for incentive compensation. Incentive compensation is not guaranteed.

Title: Data Analyst Co-op - May 2025 - Demonware (Vancouver)
Description:
Job Title:

Data Analyst Co-op - May 2025 - Demonware (Vancouver)

Requisition ID:

R024743

Job Description:

Data Analyst Co-op

Demonware (Activision), Vancouver

May 2025

This role will be required to be onsite at the Demonware Vancouver office following the team's work schedule (hybrid, 3 days a week), a relocation package may be offered depending on eligibility.

The Company

Demonware is a member of the Activision family of studios. We work alongside engineers and creatives at our AAA partner studios and deliver the online and data services required by our franchises. We craft, develop, and host services for some of the worlds biggest video game franchises, including Call of Duty and Crash Bandicoot.

We are a technology company and dedicated to openness. This means collaborating to tackle problems, the freedom to talk to anyone, and the best idea wins. We take the work seriously; ourselves, not so much!

Were open to work terms of 8+ months. If you just graduated, we still want to hear from you!

Big Company Challenges, Small Company Culture

Demonware hosts millions of concurrently connected players. Some of the technologies we use are Python, Java, Linux, Vitess, Kafka, Pinot, Spark, Databricks, Tableau. We solve tough problems on a day-to-day basis, and our Co-op students have a huge impact on what we do.

Were looking for a Data Analyst to partner closely with our Product team to drive data-informed decision-making. Youll play a critical role in uncovering insights, measuring product performance, and helping shape the product roadmap. Think of yourself as the go-to person for turning raw data into actionable insights that fuel product innovation.

The Role


Analyze and interpret data from a variety of systems, including but not limited to fraud analysis, disruptive behavior, and prosocial behavior in gaming communities.
Build,maintain, and improve dashboards and reports that inform decision making and strategy.
Identify and interpret trends and anomalies in the data, and offer opinions in support of product strategy.
Filter, clean, and validate data to ensure accuracy and reliability in reporting and analysis.
Present data findings and recommendations regularly to the Product team and other stakeholders.
Proactively surface insights and recommendations to improve player experience, reduce fraud, and foster positive behavior in gaming communities.
Collaborate regularly with Activision data science/machine learning teams and game studios.
This role is part of the Demonware product team and as a result will require an inquisitive mind that cares about the why behind the data.


Requirements


Strong attention to detail.
Proficiency in Structured Query Language (SQL).
Ability to work collaboratively with multiple teams across Activision.
Passionate about data and applying an analytical mindset to inform product decisions.
Ability to conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) and provide insights into key metrics.
A proactive attitude and eagerness to learn.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to present findings in a clear and actionable way.
The ability to work well, both autonomously, as part of a larger team, and asynchronously.


Nice-to-haves


Experience with Tableau.
Experience with proposing and running experiments.
Basic understanding of Machine Learning techniques for data analysis.
Knowledge of Big Data technologies such as Spark.
Experience in using project management tools.


Perks


Complimentary breakfast, lunch, and drinks from a fully stocked kitchen
BBQs and Lunch & Learns
City-center office location
Vacation allowance
Competitive pay
Free games


How To Apply

You can apply directly through your Co-op office or directly apply at demonware.net

If you are not applying through your school program, please submit your resume, cover letter (optional but preferred) and a copy of your most recent school transcripts.

The standard base pay range for this role is 65,000 CAD annually. This value is the expected annualized base pay of interns in British Columbia, Canada. Ultimately, your offer will be based on several factors, including relevant education, performance, and work location. Your Talent Professional can share additional details for this role during the hiring process.

We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty, Crash Bandicoot, Tony Hawks Pro Skater, and Guitar Hero. As a leading worldwide developer, publisher and distributor of interactive entertainment and products, our press start is simple: delight hundreds of millions of players around the world with innovative, fun, thrilling, and engaging entertainment experiences.

Were not just looking back at our decades-long legacy; were forging ahead to keep advancing gameplay with some of the most popular titles and sophisticated technology in the world. We have bold ambitions to create the most inclusive company as we know our success comes from the passionate, creative, and diverse teams within our organization.

Were in the business of delivering fun and unforgettable entertainment for our player community to enjoy. And our future opportunities have never been greater this could be your opportunity to level up.

Ready to Activate Your Future?

The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.

We are committed to working with and providing reasonable assistance to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you are a disabled individual requiring an accommodation to apply for an open position, please email your request to accommodationrequests@activisionblizzard.com. General employment questions cannot be accepted or processed here. Thank you for your interest.

Rewards

We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for 'Every World' - we've got our employees covered! Subject to eligibility requirements, the Company offers comprehensive benefits including:


Extended health plan, including medical, dental, vision, life and AD&D insurance, for employees and their dependents, as well as disability insurance;
RRSP with Company match, tuition reimbursement, charitable donation matching;
Paid holidays and vacation, paid sick time, compassion and bereavement leaves, parental leave;
Mental health & wellbeing programs, fitness programs, free and discounted games, and a variety of other benefit programs like supplemental life & critical illness, legal service, and others;
If the Company requires that you move geographic locations for the job, then you may also be eligible for relocation assistance.


Eligibility to participate in these benefits may vary for part time and temporary full-time employees and interns with the Company.

Title: Business Insights Analyst
Description:
Marketing Statement

Join a company that has been a part of moving Metro Vancouver for over 35 years.

British Columbia Rapid Transit Company Ltd. (BCRTC) maintains and operates the Expo and Millennium SkyTrain Lines from our central facilities in south Burnaby. Our services connect downtown Vancouver to the cities of Burnaby, New Westminster, Coquitlam, Port Moody and Surrey. With the future expansion of both the Expo and Millennium Lines gathering pace, infrastructure renewal and new asset acquisition projects underway, this is an exciting time to join our team of over 1,200 dedicated employees, working on one of the longest fully-automated rapid transit systems in the world.

Our work encompasses roles such as administration, engineering, elevator and escalator maintenance, field operations, vehicle maintenance, and wayside (station and guideway) maintenance.

When you work for SkyTrain, not only will you help move Metro Vancouver, you will also have access to comprehensive benefits including paid vacation, medical benefits, transit passes, training and more. We are a proud equal opportunity employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce.

Come explore what makes us one of BC’s Top Employers!

Responsibilities

PRIMARY PURPOSE

Develops, coordinates and maintains performance measures across the organization to ensure alignment with corporate

goals and objectives. Prepares a variety of analyses and reports to provide accurate and up-to-date information to the

management team.

Develops and maintains end-to-end data and analytics solutions to meet BCRTC’s business needs and support data-driven decision-making strategies. This includes identifying analytical goals and objectives through stakeholder engagement, developing data collection solutions, creating automated Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) processes, generating meaningful performance insights, and communicating analytical insights to various stakeholders through data visualization tools and data storytelling.

Key Accountabilities

Performance Measures & Continuous Improvement:

Collaborates with departments to explore data requirements and works with relevant managers/supervisors to develop business performance tracking and analytical solutions across all functions. Engages with relevant stakeholders in requirements gathering, data tracking, report design, delivery and sustainment.

Investigates and analyzes statistics and underlying causes and trends of business performance. Prepares periodic reports indicating business performance compared to targets and the previous year(s), and rationale for variances. Supports all corporate KPI reporting activities for various levels of management, BCRTC Board of Directors, and TransLink.

Establishes and maintains data collection, verification, and reporting processes which ensures timeliness, accuracy, and completeness of the analytical insights. Ensures solutions are reliable and comply with company’s standards, policies, processes, regulatory and other related requirements.

Leverages available benchmarking resources for best practices and provides comparable performance measures from other transit agencies and business enterprises to the concerned stakeholders towards informed decision making. Participates in annual benchmarking KPI data submission activities.

Supports corporate data & insights-driven initiatives and business planning activities as needed, e.g. Annual Performance Target Setting, Data Quality Improvement, Data Value Creation Initiatives and Data Management framework.

Supports the design, implementation, and maintenance of pipelines for data integration and ETL/ELT on modern data platforms such as Microsoft Azure Synapse, Fabric, and PowerBI.

Supports the manager to produce reports and statistical analyses for targeted areas in response to requests from media, Freedom of Information requests, Executive team, BCRTC management and supervisors.

Business Intelligence & Analytics (BI&A) Services

Provides analytical services as requested from leaders across the organization on divisional and departmental level BI&A reporting, business process digitization and automation. Ensures end users have the information needed to manage their business performance to support a culture of continuous improvement.

Designs, implements, and maintains end-to-end analytical solutions for BCRTC internal clients using modern BI platforms such as Microsoft Azure Synapse, Fabric, PowerApp, PowerAutomate, and Power BI. Ensures designed solutions are fit for purpose, cost-effective, align with standards, policies and support ongoing data & insights-driven initiatives within BCRTC. Ensures that solutions are reusable and scalable following best practices, balancing immediate short-term and long-term benefits.

Processes sensitive workforce data and develops relevant BI solutions according to enterprise policies and guidelines. Supports the completion of requisite Privacy Impact Assessment (PIA) completion for the developed data and analytics solutions.

Qualifications

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

The requirements for this job are acquired through completion of a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Management, Data Analytics, Engineering, or other relevant business-related fields plus four (4) years of experience with development and analysis of performance measurements, and technical experience with design, implementation and maintenance of data and creation of reports in a Business Intelligence environment. Master’s, Doctorate degrees, and Professional Certifications in related fields may be considered as equivalent to practical experience. Experience supporting data management or data governance programs, or in workforce-related analytics for occupational health, safety, workforce productivity and other HR analytics would be considered an asset.

Other Requirements

Solid understanding of concepts, principles, practices and techniques pertaining to all aspects of performance measures, benchmarking, balanced scorecards and dashboards.

Advanced knowledge of developing Microsoft Analytics solutions including PowerApps, Power Automate, Power BI, Azure Synapse and Fabric. Demonstrated experience in programming languages is required: e.g. SQL, R, Python.

Strong analytical, problem solving and judgment skills to be able to interpret data and diagnose data quality issues.

Strong time management, organization, verbal and written communication skills

Strong relationship management skills and ability to work across multidisciplinary teams and management levels

Ability to multi-task, manage multiple priorities and work in a rapidly changing and dynamic environment with limited supervision

Ability to listen and interpret stakeholder feedback to understand business processes and identify business issues/objectives.

Other Information

Recruitment Process: An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process. A standard interview format will be used including general, scenario and behavioural descriptive interview questions.

Work Schedule

37.5 hours per week.

Work Designation

Resident

This position works predominately on-site.

Rate of Pay

Salary: $75,600 - $113,400 per annum (Actual salary offered will be commensurate with education, experience and internal parity).

The Total Compensation Package includes Extended Health, Dental, Transit Pass and enrollment in the Public Service Pension Plan. Focus on your development through tuition reimbursement, training, and mentorship programs. Enjoy a variety of health and wellness programs, including access to gym facilities. Speak to us to know more about what we offer.

How To Apply

Please click the 'Apply' button at the top right corner or go to http://www.translink.ca/careers to apply for this position and view instructions on the process.

INSTRUCTIONS: Please save your (1) cover letter, and your (2) resume as one pdf document prior to uploading your application on-line.

Posting Date: January 09, 2025

Closing Date: Open Until Filled

Please note that only those short listed will be contacted.

Having trouble applying? Please view the System Requirements & FAQ's by going to http://www.translink.ca/careers.

Equal Employment Opportunity

SkyTrain is committed to employment equity and building a diverse workforce, representative of the customers we serve and the many communities in the Metro Vancouver region. We welcome and encourage Indigenous applicants, people of colour, all genders, 2SLGBTQ+ and persons with disabilities to apply. Learn more about TransLink's commitment to to equity, diversity and inclusion.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email us at jobs@translink.ca.
Show more

Please click the 'Apply' button at the top right corner or go to http://www.translink.ca/careers to apply for this position and view instructions on the process.

INSTRUCTIONS: Please save your (1) cover letter, and your (2) resume as one pdf document prior to uploading your application on-line.

Posting Date: January 09, 2025

Closing Date: Open Until Filled

Please note that only those short listed will be contacted.

Having trouble applying? Please view the System Requirements & FAQ's by going to http://www.translink.ca/careers.

Equal Employment Opportunity

SkyTrain is committed to employment equity and building a diverse workforce, representative of the customers we serve and the many communities in the Metro Vancouver region. We welcome and encourage Indigenous applicants, people of colour, all genders, 2SLGBTQ+ and persons with disabilities to apply. Learn more about TransLink's commitment to to equity, diversity and inclusion.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email us at jobs@translink.ca.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
We are hiring freelance English speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.

This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.

Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English
You must be living in Canada the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Canada
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.

Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Why Join the TELUS Digital Community?

Earn additional income with flexible hours to fit your lifestyle
Better work-life balance
Be your own boss
Complimentary Well-Being package encompassing a wealth of well-being resources.
Be part of an online community







TELUS Digital partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. https://telusdigital.com

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Position: Data Engineer

Location: Vancouver, Canada

Job Type: Full-Time, Remote

About Two Circles (formerly KORE Software):

Two Circles, having recently acquired KORE Software, is a leading global sports marketing agency that combines data and technology to drive growth for sports organizations. With this acquisition, we have expanded our capabilities to provide innovative business intelligence solutions tailored for the sports and entertainment industries. Together, we empower over 900 organizations worldwide with tools for CRM, sponsorship and partnership management, ticketing, event management, data warehousing, and analytics. Our mission is to revolutionize fan and stakeholder engagement through cutting-edge technology and a commitment to excellence.

About the KORE Fan Intelligence Platform:

We provide our clients fan segmentation and insights to enable them to market and engage their fan base. By leveraging fan data with our industry leading solutions, we help them understand their customers better and grow their audiences. We do this by collating data feeds from major providers such as Ticketmaster, AXS, and Seatgeek into our best-in-class data solutions at Two Circles.

Role Overview:

We are seeking experienced Cloud Data Engineer to join our rapidly growing Fan Intelligence Platform team. You will round out the team with expertise with directly managing AWS Services, with technologies such as Spark, Kinesis, and Airflow. Experience with managing large scale data pipelines is a must for this role, as well as a keen interest to explore new technologies and solutions. We are looking for someone who brings experience and passion working with the flow of data and infrastructure.

Key Responsibilities:


Work as part of a cross-functional product team to deliver a high-quality SaaS based data platform.
Design and implement data pipelines with a clear focus on data quality and reliability
Partner with both Product Management and stakeholders, technical, and non-technical team members to deliver our vision, roadmap, and data strategy
Act as an advocate for development best practices including technical design reviews, implementing test plans, monitoring/alerting, peer code reviews, and documentation
Contribute to our DevOps culture and participate in ownership of our designs through production operations
Support the ongoing maintenance and operations of the data platform
Mentor and support other engineers in the team



Requirements


Experience
3+ years of data engineering & big data systems experience with platforms like MySQL, Postgres, SQL Server, and Redshift
2+ years working with AWS services (EC2, Lambda, S3, DynamoDB, Kinesis, EMR, Redshift)


Technical Skills


Experience with various orchestration and batch processing technologies like Apache Airflow
Proficiency in Python, C#, and Scala
Strong experience with containerization such as Docker
Familiarity with monitoring tools for data pipeline performance such as New Relic
Experience developing against APIs and building scalable high systems
Experience with writing unit tests using frameworks such as PyTest for quality assurance
Understanding architectural differences between streaming and batch-oriented integrations


Soft Skills:


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong written and verbal English skills, and an ability to articulate technical information efficiently
Familiarity with Continuous Delivery systems and Lean-Agile methodologies (Scrum / Kanban)
Comfort interacting with clients or vendors directly
Mindset:
Self-starter with strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize across initiatives
Thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment



Why Join Us?


Professional Growth: Work on a variety of projects, enhancing your testing skills across different applications and technologies
Impactful Work: Play a key role in delivering high-quality solutions that shape the future of the sports and entertainment industries
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a team that values ideas, fosters a supportive atmosphere, and encourages continuous learning and improvement
Innovative Culture: Join a company committed to revolutionizing fan and stakeholder engagement through cutting-edge technology



How to Apply:

If you are passionate about quality assurance and eager to contribute to a dynamic team, we'd love to hear from you!

Apply today to join a team dedicated to excellence and innovation in delivering bespoke solutions to the world's leading sports and entertainment organizations.

Equal Opportunity Employer:

Two Circles is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Senior
Description:
At Lumenalta, we create impactful software solutions that drive innovation and transform businesses. Since 2000, we’ve partnered with visionary leaders to build cutting-edge tech, solve complex challenges, and deliver results faster through our elite teams and tech-driven approach. Join us in shaping the future of technology.




What we're working on:

Enterprise companies turn to us to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. The problems we solve daily are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. To grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally, you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.




Responsibilities

Design and build visually impactful dashboards and reports using Power BI and Tableau.
Migrate and integrate legacy Tableau systems into Power BI, ensuring consistency and usability.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data solutions.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, opportunities, and actionable insights.
Ensure data quality and accuracy through thorough validation and testing.




Requirements

7+ years experience as a data analyst.
Expertise in Power BI and Tableau (experience with both is ideal; proficiency in at least one is required).
Strong understanding of data visualization best practices.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and managing datasets.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, in English.
Industry experience in Financial Services is a plus.
Personality traits: detail-oriented, proactive, problem solver, collaborative, passionate about data.




Why Lumenalta is an amazing place to work at

At Lumenalta, you can expect that you will:

Be 100% dedicated to one project at a time so that you can innovate and grow.
Be a part of a team of talented and friendly senior-level developers.
Work on projects that allow you to use leading tech.




The result? We produce meaningful outcomes for our clients that break barriers in their industries.




The job is 100% Remote; please ensure you have a comfortable office set at your desired work location.




Lumenalta is committed to hiring exceptional talent from a wide variety of diverse backgrounds. If you share our values and enthusiasm for digital transformation, we encourage you to apply

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Driven by a love of plants, Pure Sunfarms is one of Canada’s largest, single-site, licensed producers of high-quality, greenhouse-grown cannabis based in BC’s Fraser Valley (Delta). We are proud to bring together individuals from a wide breadth of industries, backgrounds, and experiences, and promote a culture of belonging where everyone can truly be themselves – in every form of expression that is natural to them. This is our priority and guiding light at Pure Sunfarms, driving our uncompromising approach to quality and success within the Canadian recreational cannabis market. We believe our differences are our strengths, letting us look at cannabis in a whole new light.

As part our Business Solutions team, the Business Systems Analyst will provide application support for various Business Applications while providing excellent customer service and support to internal stakeholders of Pure Sunfarms staff, and occasionally visitors and guests. A key role in understanding business requirements, analyzing systems and processes, documenting specifications and ensuring that technical solutions align with business objectives.

Essential Functions

System Analysis & Documentation


Provide Tier 1 Customer Service Support for all Business Applications, including but not limited to, Information Technology (IT), Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), Warehouse Management System (WMS), Electronic Quality Management System (EQMS) and Financial Management Information Systems (FMIS) within Service Level Agreement to the different Business Partners in Pure Sunfarms
Coordinate Tier 2 Level Support with other members of the Technology Team and external partners to bring the issue to resolution when needed
Flex between Tier 1 Customer Service Support and System Enhancements in a seamlessly manner
Analyze and diagnose applications and/or business issues and provide resolutions and recommendations to either the systems or the business processes
Develop and implement system enhancements and requests that aligns with operational and systemic best practices


Collaboration


Assist with testing software updates and new module implementations
Support ongoing operations and maintenance of Business Applications
Participate in change and advisory management of technology solutions
Become a go-to person for Business Application support and/or potential issues
Ensure delivery and management of technology solutions for stakeholders are done accurately to support day to day operations execution


Solution Design


Support with the evaluation of build vs buy options, and make recommendations based on the organization’s goals, budget and technical constrains
Participate in streamlining business processes standard methodologies and training to ensure system users understand how to use various systems for optimal operation performance


Other Duties

At Pure Sunfarms, we are all growers at heart. Our plants and processes require in-person care and attention to ensure we’re bringing the best our plants and people have to offer to our consumers. This means other duties may arise since we work together to ensure we support all business activities – seed to sale.

This role is on-site, which requires you to work in Pure Sunfarms facility at all times in an operating role or directly supporting operations.

YOUR BRAND, YOUR STORY

We already know you are passionate about Business Solutions best practices, but we want to know more about your story and experiences. You're good at the following:


Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such Business Administrator, Computer Science or Information Systems
Minimum 1 year of direct related experience as Business Systems Analyst
Robust understanding and experience in Business Systems Applications such IT, ERP, WMS, EQMS and/or others relevant to the industry
Experience with IT ticketing systems (Knowledge of JIRA and Confluence is an asset)
Relevant hands-on experience with system, testing and quality assurance processes
Knowledge in reporting, integrations and master data is preferred
Familiarity with various technology platforms and their software development methodologies and lifecycle
Proficiency in requirements gathering and documentation techniques
Demonstrated ability to integrate strategic thinking with tactical activities
Highly articulate, strong interpersonal skills with a collaborative working style
Strong problem-solving abilities
Champions Pure Sunfarms’ values and competencies
Must have the ability to obtain and pass a RCMP Criminal Record Check and maintain security clearance.


At Pure Sunfarms, we are growing our team with the same care we devote to growing our plants. We’re proud of the diverse and inclusive culture that we’ve built and are excited to learn more about your experiences and how you can contribute to Pure Sunfarms and the cannabis industry.
Show more

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Job description

Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.




A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:




In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide

Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.




Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!




TELUS Digital AI Community




Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.




Qualification path

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.







Basic Requirements




Full Professional Proficiency in English & French language

Being a resident in Canada for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Canada

Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information

Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance

Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment




In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity




All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.


A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:


In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide

Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.


Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!


TELUS Digital AI Community


Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.


Qualification path

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.



Basic Requirements


Full Professional Proficiency in English & French language

Being a resident in Canada for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Canada

Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information

Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance

Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software


Assessment


In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.


Equal Opportunity


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

  • to diversity.

Title: Research Analyst
Description:
Make your next move an expert one.

At Colliers it’s not our success that sets us apart, it’s how we achieve it. Our people are passionate, take ownership and always do what’s right for our clients, people and communities.

Why Colliers?

Our enterprising environment needs your expertise to facilitate Colliers’ continued growth as an industry leader. Our nimble, decentralized culture can provide you with a wealth of opportunities to learn about our business and quickly gain experience to accelerate your career.


This position is a hybrid role (4 days in office) based out of our Vancouver, BC location.**


About You

The Research Analyst is responsible for providing a range of research and analytical support services to the Vancouver team in their market. The incumbent will provide assistance with the collection and analysis of the local commercial real estate market data to provide insights on the market and further enhance our research capability.

In this role, you will…


Prepare periodic research publications, market commentary, and other various materials including presentations, market reports, white papers on the commercial real estate market in Vancouver
Monitor industry statistics and follow trends by reading reports and staying updated on current events to lead efforts in generating research content and thought leadership pieces
Summarize and communicate analytic findings, insights and recommendations via executive-level summary documents, meetings and presentations.
Utilize database knowledge and data manipulation/query tools to manage existing Colliers’ platforms.
Assist with the review of quality control standards for the Research team and support the research and data collection function.
Actively participate and engage in meetings with the research and sales teams, building relationships within the industry.


What You’ll Bring


Undergraduate degree required. Real Estate or Business post-secondary is an asset.
2+ years’ experience in a research role. Experience in commercial real estate preferred.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including networking and relationship building ability
Intermediate proficiency of the Microsoft 365 suite including Excel, Word, PowerPoint. 
Experience in BI, data visualization and GIS tools would be an asset.
Attention to detail and an ability to meet tight deadlines without compromising quality.


Pursuant to the laws regarding job postings where the position is located in, Colliers is disclosing the following information

Area/Location Specific Vancouver, BC (Hybrid)

Approximate Salary Range for this Role $54,563.00 to $80,000.00

Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on this job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

Make your next move an expert one and join us as we lead the industry into the future.

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in Canada on a full-time basis. The employer will not sponsor applicants for work visas.

Direct applicants only please, no agencies.

Colliers is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. Colliers encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants' disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the recruitment team by email at careers@colliers.com.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Our client has an immediate opening for an experienced Data Engineer to join their team.

In your new role as a Data Engineer, you will be involved in projects and work with the team to achieve high quality data integrations and responsible for design and development of scalable data solutions.

This is your chance to contribute to the ongoing Data Platform enhancements to support strategic business initiatives.




A typical day would involve:

Design and build efficient & reliable data pipelines, cleanse, and normalize diverse datasets for Analytics.
Troubleshoot and resolve problems of data services that support business & applications systems and provide solutions to pro-actively prevent problems from happening.
Create and manage knowledgebase, access controls, deployment pipeline architecture and infrastructure related to Data Platform.
Help drive transformation by continuously looking for ways to automate existing processes and optimize for efficiency and data quality, redesigning infrastructure for greater scalability, etc
Represent team as a subject matter expert for strategic projects and contribute to end-to-end data architecture solutions.

You are:

Customer-centric: You define and measure success through the eyes of your internal customers and anticipate, understand and respond to their evolving needs. Demonstrate strong follow through and consistently keep commitments to members and team.
Results-oriented: You have a demonstrated ability to engage stakeholders to elicit requirements, analyze findings, generate appropriate solutions, and build deliverables all while securing the team's commitment to these solutions.
Technology savvy: You have education and/or experience supporting technology development/implementation efforts.
Curious & innovative: You always do your research and analysis to assess and recommend a course of action based on industry, political and economic trends, you can identify risks and opportunities that may impact the business unit and or designated area.

You have:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a related technical discipline.
3+ years of industry experience in Data Engineering or related field handling data processing and transformation of disparate datasets
Experience with big data and analytics programming languages such as Python, R, Spark in Databricks
Experience with batch and real-time processing frameworks (EventHub, Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, etc.)
Willingness to work in a highly flexible environment with multiple competing priorities.
Proven ability to innovate and adapt to the latest development in area of expertise. Ability to adapt and grasp new skills and content.




Bonus points, if you have:

Experience in design and implementation of data integrations in Azure data stack such as Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, EventHub.
Exposure to DevSecOps practices to incorporate security first principles.
Good understanding of data storage, data mapping and modelling, real-time data handling

Title: Senior Criminal Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Position Information

Title Senior Criminal Intelligence Analyst Job Status Regular Full Time Position Overview

The City of North Vancouver is the urban core of the beautiful North Shore and has a long-term vision to be “The Healthiest Small City in the World”, with five key priorities to be a City for People, a Resilient City, a Vibrant City, a Connected City and a Prosperous City.

The Police Services Department is seeking to hire a regular full-time Senior Criminal Intelligence Analyst for the RCMP Detachment.

Responsibilities

In this position you will perform supervisory work of one or more employees. This position involves complex work and requires specialized statistical and analytical support of criminal investigations and the development of detachment projects and programs. You will plan, assign, review and coordinate the work of employees engaged in crime and/or intelligence analysis work, and assist in project design and implementation. You will also collect, evaluate, analyze and interpret a variety of investigative and intelligence information, monitor and identify crime patterns and trends, and prepare reports and recommendations based upon analytical findings.

Requirements

You will possess a university degree in a related discipline, such as criminology, economics, sociology, statistics or another discipline related to the work, supplemented by the completion of at least one or more recognized specialty analytic training programs or certifications. As well as considerable knowledge of research, statistical and analytical practices, procedures, methods and techniques, or an equivalent combination of training and experience. You will have sound knowledge of the criminal justice system, preferably in a policing environment. Working knowledge of relevant software (PRIME, CPIC, i2 Analyst Notebook, iBase, Microsoft Office, specialized mapping software) and superior communication and presentation skills are required as you will provide presentations, briefing and situation reports, and present results, conclusions and recommendations verbally and in writing. You will also establish and maintain effective working relationships with regular members, City employees and external and partner agencies.

You must have strong interpersonal and teamwork skills with the ability to multi-task, work well under pressure and deal with sensitive situations using a high level of professionalism.

Preference will be given to candidates with a minimum of three years’ experience working as a Criminal Intelligence Analyst and who have successfully passed the RCMP National Test for Intelligence Analysts.

Compensation

$50.13 to $56.82 per hour

(Pay Grade 28 – January 2024 rates)

Hours of Work

Any 8 consecutive hours exclusive of a one hour unpaid meal break between the hours of 6:00am – 11:00pm, any five consecutive days of seven. The City of North Vancouver currently works on a compressed work schedule of 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., Monday to Friday, with one scheduled day off (Monday or Friday) approximately each three-week scheduling cycle. The City offers a hybrid remote working arrangement.

Additional Information

You will be required to obtain and maintain an enhanced RCMP security clearance as a condition of ongoing employment.

Shortlisted candidates may be required to complete standardized tests or exercises to demonstrate their applicable skills and knowledge.

How to Apply

If you are passionate about making the City of North Vancouver an even greater place to live, work and play, apply on-line through the Career Portal at www.cnv.org by Thursday, February 20, 2025.

Posting Detail Information

Posting Number 2025-0018 Job Open Date 01/29/2025 Job Close Date 02/20/2025 Special Instructions to Applicants

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Insight Global is looking to hire a Data Engineer for a retail client based in Vancouver. This role is a hybrid position and requires 3 days onsite/week in Downtown Vancouver. You will be joining a team that works heavily with customer data - owning the customer data pipelines that gather data coming from multiple sources and consolidating that data for different use cases. The team has completed the implementation of an analytics tool to gather customer data from the web, and they are now tasked with moving the data from the analytics platform to their internal Snowflake platform. The ideal candidate will possess experience migrating data from a Google stack of GCP/BigQuery to an Azure/Snowflake environment. The successful candidate will be contributing to all areas of development, and operations and participate in day-to-day production releases and on-call support functions as needed. Additional projects include:

Creation and maintenance od data pipelines (GCP, Azure Cloud, Azure Databricks, Snowflake)
Creation of secure data views and publish them to the Enterprise Data Exchange via Snowflake
Modernization and migration of data pipelines using Databricks Delta Tables (DLT) and Unity Catalog
Analysis of Adobe Analytics GA4 analytics data




Qualifications:

3-5 years of experience with database engineering – building out and deploying data pipelines, ideally working with customer data
Experience with Google Analytics (version 4) or Adobe Analytics or any other analytics platform
3+ years of experience working with Azure applications (Azure Data Factory, Azure Batch, Azure SQL Server, Azure Data Warehouse, Azure Databricks, etc.) and building out Azure pipelines
2+ years of experience working with Azure Databricks
Experience with GCP and BigQuery
Strong scripting experience with Python & SQL
Experience working in an Agile environment
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal




Plusses:

Retail and/or e-commerce experience; experience working for a multi-channel retailer
Experience with Snowflake or any enterprise data warehouse
